description.narrative: National M&E and data systems are strengthened so as to increasingly support evidence-based policies and programmes, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Evaluation And Research, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, poor children benefit from inclusive development being a central objective of national and sectoral policies

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National M&E and data systems are strengthened so as to increasingly support evidence-based policies and programmes

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the NDPC with Ghana's VNR process and facilitated the drafting of summary findings report for MICS6. UNICEF provided national-level data that ensured the VNR process provided a detailed overview of the situation of women and children in Ghana. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/08/2019

title.narrative: Coverage of regional level multi-country or multi-sector evaluations
Nationally prioritized recommendations to strengthen key sectoral M&E systems implemented through UNICEF

baseline.value: Assessment currently underway through GSS/NDPC to identify recommendations for strengthening sectoral M&E systems

target.value: 2018:At least one recommnedation on a sectoral MIS relevant to UNICEF implemented through UNICEF's support

actual.value: 2018:National Statistics Capacity Assessment Report was launched and disseminated at the national and sub-national levels in October 2018. Key recommendations, including those on sectoral MIS were identified and implementation (of recommendations) started. For instance, UNICEF has been developing Basic

title.narrative: Existence of a National Evaluation Policy

target.value: 2022:Existence of an approved National Evaluation Policy

actual.value: 2019:A draft National Evaluation Policy was updated based on a series of stakeholder and submitted to cabinet for review

title.narrative: Existence of disaggregated national household survey data on child-focused targets of SDGs collected within the preceding 5 years

target.value: 2019:MICS Summary Findings Report (SFR) completed and disseminated

actual.value: 2020:MICS Summary Findings Report (SFR) was finalized. Disemmination is planned for Q1 of 2020
